comments.content:
This is pretty cool.  
(Great name too.)

hhp
The first hairy font I've ever loved.
Lovely. I see the light trails of fairies and fireflies.

As Paris Hilton would say... that's hot.

Mikey

Simply awesome.  
Normally, i'm not a taker for this kind of stuff, but this looks so well done and convincing – congrats.

Mike, I think the current hip qualifier is "sick".

hhp

How many points per glyph? I know this is a short headline face but was curious about the overhead.

ChrisL

hrant\> ahahahhahahha good one. Sick indeed. 'Nasty' and 'Pro-Nasty' are also in heavy use.

Mikey

Whatever happened to groovy? :-)

ChrisL

Wow, that was really, really nice. I would love to use it sometime.

Could I ask you, since I am doing a font that also must be built up with thousands of points on each glyph – how did you do it? =)

I recently posted this thread:  
 [http://typophile.com/node/19828](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419055241/http:/typophile.com/node/19828 "http://typophile.com/node/19828")

For me it seems impossible to make a user friendly font when the font has a lot of points. On the other hand I have seen fonts that carries over thousand points on each glyph, so I guess I must be doing something wrong?

Is there some tips you could share, I would be very grateful.

Thanks, and once again - VERY cool typeface you did.

THANK YOU!!!

Just stumbled on this old thread. Nothing much to add to all this except that Lore commented on 11 May last year: … but more than Porcelain or Selfish it does remind me of Hurricane Supadupa ...

Just for your info Lore, the Hurricane Supadupa is nothing but the Porcelain superimposed on the Selfish (or the other way round if you like). Looks like there is a lot of 'borrowing' in these designs.
While you're at it, look at Porcelain and Bickham Script…

True, Oystein, true. But at least Eduardo took the trouble to make some changes before superimposing. G, S, ... That is something else than plain forward superimposing.  
But that was not really the point. Just noticed that Lore did not notice that Hurricane Superdupa was nothing but a combination of the 2 fonts she mentioned before. That's all.

Btw the Hurricane Superdupa is not available anymore on type|size=0's site. Now says it is a 'private' font.
